text:
The Bowery, north from Canal Street and viewing towards the Grand Street station. A similar view to this appears in King's Handbook of New York of 1893 (published in 1897)-page 841.

1884

Gift Thru New York Historical Society
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street

text:
(1)
Bowery, west side, south from Canal, to, but not including Bayard Streets. The view shows the Thalia Theatre, (46-48 Bowery) and Atlantic Gardens, adjoining it on the north.

May 25, 1904.

Brown Brothers.

(2)
The same, at a later date and showing the Thalia Theatre in a state of collapse. Also shown is the Citizens Saving Bank, re-placing the former building on the corner. In the foreground, a portion of the Manhattan Bridge Plaza, erection of which necessitated a structual change in the Third Ave., Elevated.

December 26, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, a closer view.

September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street

text:
Canal Street, at the S.W. corner of the Bowery. Building shown in the process of erection, is the Citizen's Savings Bank.

About 1920.

Gift of E. M. Jenks.
title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery

text:
(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Canal Street. (street level not shown). The view shows a portion of the Canal Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated.

October 11, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same and including a limited view northward. In the foreground appears a portion of Manhattan Bridge Plaza.

June, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street

text:
(1)

title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street

text:
The Bowery, west side, south from but not including Canal Street. Also shown is a general view southwestward from the Manhattan Bridge Approach of the City Hall Zone skyline. Depicted prominently of which are the Singer, Municipal, Woolworth Buildings and the new County Court House. Tenement houses intervening between the fore and background comprise a locality known as Chinatown; of which the Thalia Theatre with the Atlantic Gardens adjoining (photo studio) was a well known land mark.

About 1927.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street

text:
(1) Bowery, west side, north from but not including Canal Street. Canal Street has been widened and the cigar store shown in the foreground, is on the N.W. corner.

August 30, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, a frontal view of building's in the foreground of No. 1

August 30, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, as No. 2 and showing a view further northward.

August 30, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery

text:
(1)
Bowery, West side, south from but not including Canal Street. The Atlantic Garden is shown with the Thalia Theatre adjoining.

June 25, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same.

June 13, 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3)
A view of the upper portions of buildings shown in 1 & 2, as seen from the Manhattan Bridge Plaza and across the Third Ave. Elevated structure.

June 13, 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

text:
(1) Footpath and old street car line approach to Manhattan Bridge, at the New York end. December 26, 1929. P. L. Sperr.

(2) Manhattan approach to Manhattan Bridge, at the Bridge Plaza, (Canal Street and the Bowery). December 26, 1929. P. L. Sperr.
title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge - [Footpath and old street.]

text:
(1) Footpath and old street car line approach to Manhattan Bridge, at the New York end. December 26, 1929. P. L. Sperr.

(2) Manhattan approach to Manhattan Bridge, at the Bridge Plaza, (Canal Street and the Bowery). December 26, 1929. P. L. Sperr.
title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge - [Footpath and old street.]

text:
Canal Street, north side, east from the Bowery. This view shows the vehicular approach of the Manhattan Bridge.

April 30, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery

July 9, 1932
P. L. Sperr, photographer

title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery

text:
(1)
Bowery, east side, north from Canal Street. Bales of paper stock shown in the foreground, are for the Jewish Press Publication Co., who occupy Nos. 77-79 Bowery, adjoining the N.E. corner of Canal Street.
September 25, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; slightly northward. Note the New Universal Motion Picture Theatre, at the S.E. corner of Hester Street.
September 25, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Manhattan Bridge: looking up from Bowery and Canal St., Manhattan, to Nassau and Bridge Streets, Brooklyn.

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer.

Nov. 11, 1936
[Note: Negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code II A4b
title: Bridges - Manhattan Bridge.
